result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad D Slack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
*May serve half of the time on electronic monitor, if qualify, if probation is revoked.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

*Comply with any juvenile court order with regards to E.L.J.H. and A.M.H.
*Provide DNA Sample

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad D Slack

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice returned

Defendant Chad D Slack in court with attorney Christopher G. Klingman. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:00 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address is verified.

There is a plea agreement. Defendant will plead to charge.
Atty Constable states the plea agreement.

Atty Klingman concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Klingman for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Found Guilty Neglecting a Child as alleged

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Klingman makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a fair recommendation.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, intends to follow the agreement.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 30 Days, Imposed and Stayed
Huber granted for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow
May serve half of the time on electronic monitor if qualify, if probation is revoked
Probation for a period of 12 Months
Conditions:
Comply with any juvenile court order with regards to E.L.J.H.  and A.M.H.
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Provide a DNA Sample
Plea hearing on May 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Record Update
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Chad D Slack in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:43 p.m. case is called.
This is a voluntary appearance on a return on warrant.
Court questions the defendant - address PO Box 54, Wittenberg, WI 54499
Defendant makes statement to the court.  
ADA makes statement to the court that the defendant's attorney was granted withdrawal as counsel of the defendant last week.
ADA makes additional statement as to the status of this matter.  
Court questions defendant.  
Defendant makes statement to the court 

BTC:
Court continues the condition of signature bond.
Court quashes the warrant.
Court orders that Defendant must make application with Public Defender's office and must be done before the end of this week.
Court orders the defendant to provide the Clerk of Courts within 24 hours of any change of address.
The pre-trial conference is a mandatory appearance.  If he does not appear the court will issue a warrant for his arrest.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.
